Class Memory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Memory

  • public class Memory
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements functionality associated with the memory device of the simulated system.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Memory(Queue memoryQueue, long memorySize, Statistics statistics)
      Creates a new memory device with the given parameters.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Process checkMemory(long clock)
      Checks whether or not there is enough free memory to let the first process in the memory queue proceed to the cpu queue.
      long getMemorySize()
      Returns the amount of memory in the memory device.
      void insertProcess(Process p)
      Adds a process to the memory queue.
      void processCompleted(Process p)
      This method is called when a process is exiting the system.
      void timePassed(long timePassed)
      This method is called when a discrete amount of time has passed.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Memory

        public Memory(Queue memoryQueue,
      long memorySize,
      Statistics statistics)
        Creates a new memory device with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        memoryQueue - The memory queue to be used.
        memorySize - The amount of memory in the memory device.
        statistics - A reference to the statistics collector.

    • Method Detail

      • getMemorySize

        public long getMemorySize()
        Returns the amount of memory in the memory device.
        Returns:
        The size of the memory device.

      • insertProcess

        public void insertProcess(Process p)
        Adds a process to the memory queue.
        Parameters:
        p - The process to be added.

      • checkMemory

        public Process checkMemory(long clock)
        Checks whether or not there is enough free memory to let the first process in the memory queue proceed to the cpu queue. If there is, the process that was granted memory is returned, otherwise null is returned.
        Parameters:
        clock - The current time.

      • timePassed

        public void timePassed(long timePassed)
        This method is called when a discrete amount of time has passed.
        Parameters:
        timePassed - The amount of time that has passed since the last call to this method.

      • processCompleted

        public void processCompleted(Process p)
        This method is called when a process is exiting the system. The memory allocated to this process is freed.
        Parameters:
        p - The process that is leaving the system.
